snippet: The decision on Thursday was a blow to Commissioner Roger Goodell, who was told by a federal judge that he overstepped his authority in suspending Brady.
abstract: Federal Judge Richard M Berman rules against NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell, throwing out four-game suspension levied against New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady in connection with alleged manipulation of footballs during January championship game; ruling, which focuses on narrow question of Goodell's authority to carry out such a suspension under NFL's collective bargaining agreement with players' union, is likely to be appealed by league.

byline.contributor: Tom Pedulla contributed reporting from Foxborough, Mass.

lead_paragraph: The decision on Thursday was a blow to Commissioner Roger Goodell, who was told by a federal judge that he overstepped his authority in suspending Brady.

headline.main: Judge Erases Tom Brady’s Suspension; N.F.L. Says It Will Appeal
headline.print_headline: N.F.L.’s Leader Finds Authority Is Not Absolute
